intro: Prenanthes aspera, commonly known as rough bladderwort, is a member of the Onagraceae family. It is a small herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist or wet habitats such as marshes and pond edges. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers with four petals. Its roots are often submerged, and it can form dense colonies in aquatic environments. Prenanthes aspera is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-rich, shallow water conditions.
